intro: Sersalisia kaessneri, commonly known as the Cape mountain tea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually white or pink and are visited by various pollinators. Sersalisia kaessneri is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
